perturbation.original_text:
1.   DEFINITIONS.
     (i) "Net Revenues" means all monetary consideration theglobe actually
receives for CPM- or CPC-based advertisements and promotions (other than those
for its commerce partners) delivered in connection with the Co-Branded Pages,
less a sales and administration fee of 15%.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.   DEFINITIONS.
     (i) "Net Revenues" means all monetary consideration theglobe actually
receives for CPM- or CPC-based advertisements and promotions (other than those
for its commerce partners) delivered in connection with the Co-Branded Pages,
less a sales and administration expense of 15%.
perturbation.explanation: The terms "fee" and "expense" are used interchangeably. While seemingly minor, this introduces ambiguity in the contract, particularly in Section 6 (Payment Terms), where the method of payment and auditing of these fees/expenses is discussed. The different terminology can lead to confusion on how this deduction should be treated for accounting purposes.

perturbation.original_text:
2.4  Service Operation.  Boxlot shall host and operate the Service under
the Domain Name in accordance with the terms of Exhibit B.
perturbation.changed_text:
2.4  Platform Operation.  Boxlot shall host and operate the Service under
the Domain Name in accordance with the terms of Exhibit B.
perturbation.explanation: The terms "Service" and "Platform" are used interchangeably. This introduces ambiguity in the contract. While seemingly minor, this introduces ambiguity in the contract, particularly in Section 2.2 which dictates Initial Development of "Co-Branded Pages using the Page Templates" of the service. If they are treated as separate entities, it opens up the question of whether Boxlot is developing the correct areas of the Platform to work with the Co-Branded pages.

perturbation.original_text:
5.  USER DATA.
     5.1  Rights/Restrictions.  Except as specified in this section, each party
may freely use and disclose any information (both individual and aggregated)
about Users ("User Data").
perturbation.changed_text:
5.  CUSTOMER DATA.
     5.1  Rights/Restrictions.  Except as specified in this section, each party
may freely use and disclose any information (both individual and aggregated)
about Users ("User Data").
perturbation.explanation: The terms "User Data" and "Customer Data" are used interchangeably. This introduces ambiguity in the contract, because it makes it unclear whether a user and customer is the same thing. It makes it unclear as to what information constitutes as one or the other, and therefore obfuscates the obligations when regarding those terms.
